content: Journalist Seymour Hersh: "Under President Bush’s authority, they’ve been going into countries, not talking to the ambassador or the CIA station chief, and finding people on a list and executing them and leaving. That’s been going on, in the name of all of us." “Under the Bush Administration’s interpretation of the law, clandestine military activities, unlike covert C.I.A. operations, do not need to be depicted in a Finding, because the President has a constitutional right to command combat forces in the field without congressional interference.” "http://www.minnpost.com/ericblackblog/2009/03/1 1/7310/investigative_reporter_seymour_hersh_describes_executive _assassination_ring" If this is true, then democracy and our constitution as we know it has died a horible and lonely death.

It ain't a game of chess any more, and the pieces don't operate on the board or above the table any more - on either side - - Wandering and Wondering
